items.headline: I’m holding my $400K life savings in cash because I’m worried about a stock-market crash. Do I dare invest?
items.summary_en: “I’m 44. I have been retired for three years now.”
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: ‘I don’t come from money’: I received $1.2 million after a family tragedy. Am I foolish to keep it in a money-market account?
items.summary_en: “Having a large sum just sitting there freaks me out.”
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: ‘I don’t wish to be petty’: My mom, 94, is leaving her $1 million estate to me, my brother and his daughter. Is that fair?
items.summary_en: “My share of the home alone would be valued at $300K per the trust. If she distributes the funds three ways, my share becomes $200K.”
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: ‘We’re in a market bubble based on AI exuberance’: I’m moving my $200K IRA to a money-market account. Is that wise?
items.summary_en: “I will also draw Social Security when I reach 70, which will be $3,500 per month.”
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: ‘My monthly expenses are $6,500’: I’m 64, have $1.2 million in a 401(k) and two mortgages. Can I afford to retire?
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: ‘He thinks nothing of spending $40K on a new car’: My husband gives me the silent treatment. How can we agree on finances?
items.summary_en: “I’m looking for a financial planner, marriage counselor and, possibly, a divorce attorney.”
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: I want to escape the U.S. political climate and be a ‘digital nomad’ abroad. I’m 46 and earn $98,000 — how can I do this?
items.summary_en: “My ideal situation is probably to live and travel abroad for nine months out of the year and be in the U.S. for about three months.”

items.headline: ‘He’s the breadwinner’: Does my husband take Social Security at 66 — or get $800 extra at 70?
items.summary_en: “My husband jokes that he will never be able to retire because we do not own a home.”
